radiographic_examinations.findings: The recipient twin had a history of stage II breast cancer and underwent a right mastectomy, followed by immediate reconstruction. Postoperative radiation therapy led to the exposure and infection of the silicone prosthesis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No specific imaging findings over time described.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The recipient twin had a history of invasive carcinoma of the left breast treated with mastectomy, followed by postoperative chemotherapy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Signs of ischemia were observed in the distal inferior lateral aspect of the flap, requiring debridement.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Recipient twin underwent left prophylactic mastectomy with implant reconstruction and later developed symptomatic capsular contracture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The recipient twin exhibited contracture of the irradiated skin superiorly requiring flap revisions.
